cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba and 105 mi S of Long Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Bahamas toward the east coast of Florida, then paralleling the U.S. Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the east-central coast of Florida (around North Palm Beach–Cape Canaveral)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches posted for Puerto Rico
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – no warnings posted for Puerto Rico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern, Central and Northwestern Bahamas, then Florida east coast northward to Georgia/South Carolina
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: Already passed – closest approach occurred prior to 2016-10-05
weather_observation.expected_leaving_port_date: Already outside port area of influence
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (San Juan, PR not included in the wind-probability table – probabilities <3 %)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional breezy conditions possible from distant outer bands, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds are not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light outer-band showers possible; heavy rainfall is not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells creating hazardous surf and rip currents along the north and east-facing beaches of Puerto Rico.
